intro: Alcicornium vulgare, commonly known as the common bluebell, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe. It features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Alcicornium vulgare is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
